title: Why isn't higher education more interdisciplinary? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is just a guess, but I have an informed opinion having been there. Professors in various disciplines, as far as I can tell, think (incorrectly) that no one is as smart as they are (though they won’t say it outright). They have a natural tendency not to want to work with lesser mortals in other fields. When I was in graduate school 50 years ago, people were seriously talking about increasing interdisciplinary efforts, but it never seemed to catch on to the extent envisioned.
